page.title: 09SPORT
page.content: {Woore Cricket Club,}which plays in the South Cheshire League, has been a part of village life for many years. It has reached the quarter-final of the{Haig National Competition,}but has not done as well in Knock-out cricket recently as it did some years ago. Attempts are being made to re-start a{village football team,}which, in pre-war years, played on the field now occupied by the school. {The badminton club}runs two teams in local leagues, and plays in the Victory Hall. A group from the village cleared the tennis court behind the Manor House, and that is back in use as a{tennis {club. {The bowls club}has a new green, thanks to the Swan Hotel and plays in local league. There has been great revitalisation!
